Job Title: Superintendent - Reporting, Planning & Analysis - FIFO to PNG
Ad Text:
About New Porgera

New Porgera Limited (NPL) is a company incorporated in Papua New Guinea and owns the Porgera Gold Mine in Enga Province. The Porgera Gold Mine will employ nearly 3,000 Papua New Guineans at full production, and over the last 30 years of life of the mine it has contributed approximately 10% of Papua New Guinea’s total annual exports.

About the role

The Superintendent - Reporting, Planning & Analysis is responsible for leading the financial planning and budgeting for the Finance Team. This role ensures financial data is accurate, delivered on time, and supports operational decision-making. Reporting to the Alternate Finance Manager, you will lead a team of Finance Business Partners, managing financial forecasting, variance analysis, management and external reporting.

You will model safety behaviours and coach and develop your team, working with your team to assess and manage risk.  NPL operates in a complex environment that requires the successful applicant to be a self-starter, with strong ability in delivery to support the mines successful operation whilst coordinating the efforts of your team members to complete projects according to plan in a timely and safe manner.

About you  

This role leads Life of Mine (LoM) budgeting and forecasting, develops financial models, and delivers management reporting to senior leadership while driving continuous process improvement. You will oversee cost management, including month-end close, variance analysis, financial controls, and supporting department managers in understanding key cost drivers. The position also provides leadership to a team of Finance Business Partners, fostering capability development and promoting strong engagement with operational teams. Proficiency in SAP FICO, Xeras, OneStream, Thinkcell, Excel, and Oracle ARCs is highly regarded.

The ideal candidate brings strong financial acumen across planning, budgeting, and cost analysis, paired with the ability to interpret performance trends and identify improvements. They excel in business partnering, building relationships with senior leaders and operational teams to drive accountability and support informed decision-making. Strong strategic and analytical thinking, clear communication, and the ability to influence outcomes are essential. The role requires proven leadership in developing high-performing teams, along with solid systems capability across SAP FICO, Xeras, OneStream, and advanced Excel for modelling and data management.

You will demonstrate a ‘One Team’ approach, providing effective leadership and development for your local team to reinforce NPL’s culture and values, always promoting a safe work environment.  The position requires a high energy individual, hands-on management style and desire to continuously improve you and your team’s knowledge and systems and methods of work.

Why New Porgera

In return, you will be joining a world-class mining operation with the opportunity to impact the development and upskilling of our predominantly local workforce, combined with a team keen to learn and absorb knowledge.  This offers a unique opportunity to further shape the department and improve NPL’s social performance and people knowledge. 

You will be joining an operation that prioritises safety, leading a team toward best-in-class safety practices while contributing to the development of a highly capable national workforce—making a lasting impact on the industry.

This role is offered on a FIFO basis either from Papua New Guinea, Australia/New Zealand with a 21/14 roster on a contract basis with a highly competitive remuneration package.

This advert will close on the 19 December.  To understand more about this position, please contact tali.butler@npltd.com

AEMO is Australia’s independent energy system and market operator and system planner. We have the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to co-design the future of our energy systems, and our core values revolve around character, commitment, and connection. Join us as we contribute to this significant transition in the energy sector.    

About the role  

The Operations Division plays a critical role in AEMO's success, ensuring the secure and efficient functioning of Australia's wholesale and retail energy markets and systems. Within this division, the Gas Market Operations team oversees the monitoring and management of AEMO's east coast wholesale gas markets. The team's responsibilities include analysing and reporting key market events to stakeholders in publications and to industry forums. Additionally, the team provides support to market participants, responding to queries, actioning tasks and offering education on gas market operations. The team also engages with industry stakeholders and other business units within AEMO to implement market enhancements. 

You will make an important contribution to gas market operations, in the areas of affordability of gas to consumers and the security and reliability of gas. You will also focus on market monitoring, involving investigation, and reporting of outcomes in the wholesale gas markets, enabling AEMO and our stakeholders to make informed decisions. 

The role has potential to be included in an on-call roster to support markets outside of business hours and can be based in Brisbane or Melbourne. 

What you will be doing

Utilise problem-solving skills to analyse market operations to determine and report on the impact on participants of wholesale gas market outcomes and opportunities for market improvement. This will include contributing to preparing reports for publication on market events and present reports at forums/meetings on market outcomes.

Respond to inquiries and requests submitted by market participants, executing market specific tasks as outlined in established procedures.

Mentor and guide junior staff in their day-to-day activities.

Analyse data leveraging previous experience with Power BI dashboards, SQL queries or Python to streamline data extraction and reporting.

Develop skills in understanding the regulatory environment including the National Gas Law, National Gas Rules and relevant Market Procedures. 

What you will bring to the role

Bachelor’s degree or higher in economics, commerce, law, finance, information technology, engineering or a related discipline.

Experience working in the energy sector with an in-depth knowledge of AEMO gas markets.  

Experience in mentoring junior staff.

Capability to interpret, operate in compliance with and develop technical documents and/or procedures.

Proficiency in MS Office Suite, Power BI, SQL or Python, plus experience in IT/software requirements, design, testing, and change management would be an advantage.
